body.p: Pietism names an experiential approach to Christian spirituality that emphasizes personal holiness and the appropriation of faith over formal expressions of doctrine and theology. Since its late-17th century beginnings within German Lutheranism, the pietist movement has blended together tendencies of mysticism with mutual edification and formation, principally in the form of collegia pietatisâ€”small groups devoted to prayer and scripture. Such social structuring is evident in Moravianism's Herrnut settlement, which itself which influenced Wesley and the subsequent shape of Methodism.
